on-behalf-of.description: The `on-behalf-of` header allows you to make API calls from a parent account on behalf of the parent's Subusers or customer accounts. You will use the parent account's API key when using this header. When making a call on behalf of a customer account, the property value should be "account-id" followed by the customer account's ID (e.g., `on-behalf-of: account-id `). When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: `). See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

The `on-behalf-of` header allows you to make API calls from a parent account on behalf of the parent's Subusers or customer accounts. You will use the parent account's API key when using this header. When making a call on behalf of a customer account, the property value should be "account-id" followed by the customer account's ID (e.g., `on-behalf-of: account-id `). When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: `). See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: `). See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

The `on-behalf-of` header allows you to make API calls from a parent account on behalf of the parent's Subusers or customer accounts. You will use the parent account's API key when using this header. When making a call on behalf of a customer account, the property value should be "account-id" followed by the customer account's ID (e.g., `on-behalf-of: account-id `). When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: `). limit.description: `limit` sets the page size, i.e. maximum number of items from the list to be returned for a single API request. If omitted, the default page size is used.

offset.description: The number of items in the list to skip over before starting to retrieve the items for the requested page. The default `offset` of `0` represents the beginning of the list, i.e. the start of the first page. To request the second page of the list, set the `offset` to the page size as determined by `limit`. Use multiples of the page size as your `offset` to request further consecutive pages. E.g. assume your page size is set to `10`. An `offset` of `10` requests the second page, an `offset` of `20` requests the third page and so on, provided there are sufficiently many items in your list.

result.description: The list of all mail settings.

description.description: A description of the mail setting.

enabled.description: Indicates if this mail setting is currently enabled.

name.description: The name of the mail setting.

title.description: The title of the mail setting.

enabled.description: Indicates if you have an email address whitelist enabled.

list.description: All email addresses that are currently on the whitelist.

enabled.description: Indicates if the bounce purge mail setting is enabled.

hard_bounces.description: The number of days after which SendGrid will purge all contacts from your hard bounces suppression lists.

soft_bounces.description: The number of days after which SendGrid will purge all contacts from your soft bounces suppression lists.

enabled.description: Indicates if the bounce purge mail setting is enabled.

hard_bounces.description: The number of days after which SendGrid will purge all contacts from your hard bounces suppression lists.

soft_bounces.description: The number of days after which SendGrid will purge all contacts from your soft bounces suppression lists.

enabled.description: Indicates if the Footer mail setting is currently enabled.

html_content.description: The custom HTML content of your email footer.

plain_content.description: The plain text content of your email footer.

enabled.description: Indicates if the Footer mail setting is currently enabled.

html_content.description: The custom HTML content of your email footer.

plain_content.description: The plain text content of your email footer.

email.description: The email address that you would like your bounce reports forwarded to.

enabled.description: Indicates if the bounce forwarding mail setting is enabled.

email.description: The email address that you would like your bounce reports forwarded to.

enabled.description: Indicates if the bounce forwarding mail setting is enabled.

email.description: The email address where you would like the spam reports to be forwarded.

enabled.description: Indicates if the Forward Spam setting is enabled.

email.description: The email address where you would like the spam reports to be forwarded.

enabled.description: Indicates if the Forward Spam setting is enabled.
Indicates if the legacy email template setting is enabled.

html_content.description: The HTML content that you want to use for your legacy email template.

enabled.description: Indicates if your email address whitelist is enabled.

list.description: Either a single email address that you want whitelisted or a domain, for which all email addresses belonging to this domain will be whitelisted.

enabled.description: Indicates if you want to enable the legacy email template mail setting.

html_content.description: The new HTML content for your legacy email template.

enabled.description: Indicates if the legacy email template mail setting is enabled.

html_content.description: The HTML content of your legacy email template.
